document_data.name: Cragh
document_data.mainbody: '''Cragh''' was a [[Netherese]] [[arcanist]] of the [[Golden Age of Netheril|Golden Age]] of [[Netheril]] who was born [[deaf]] and developed the spell ''[[deafness]]''.
document_data.Description: Unable to speak, he communicated entirely via sign language, only saying a few syllables when required for spellcasting.
document_data.Abilities: The skilled [[archwizard]] and [[mentalist]] was able to cast the majority of his [[spell]]s without requiring [[verbal component]]s, apart from those of very high power.
document_data.Relationships: As well as being well respected by archwizards of Netheril, Cragh gained the respect of the [[dwarves]] that dwelt in [[Ascore]]. They named him "dwarf-friend" and he went to visit them in their stronghold quite often.
document_data.History:
Cragh was born in {{YearlinkConvert|1759|NY}}. Deaf from birth, he dedicated himself to the study of [[magic]] and became very skilled within the field, becoming the greatest [[archwizard]] of [[Northreach]] all through the 1800s.

He developed the ''Cragh's deafness'' spell, as it was then known, in {{YearlinkConvert|1860|NY}}.

He passed away in {{YearlinkConvert|1865|NY}}.
